The charred power control room of the mobile phone tower in Chope village of Jharkhand's Latehar district on Friday.- Photo: PTI

Maoists on Friday blew up a panchayat building and later set on fire the tower of a private telecom company in Latehar district of Jharkhand, the police said.

The guerrillas belonging to the banned CPI-Maoist group blasted Newadi panchayat bhawan at Dihi village and later torched a tower of Airtel at Chope village which is about 130 km from here, said a police official.

The Maoists also pasted posters at the two villages.

Meanwhile, in Gadchiroli district, Maharashtra, a 32-year-old man from Chhattisgarh suffered serious injuries after he was attacked allegedly by a group of Naxals on the suspicion of his being a police informer.

According to the police, the victim identified as Lakhan, was brought to the forest area of Kottagudam in the district from Chhattisgarh on Thursday night and thrashed.

“A woman Naxal commander, Mangi, was killed in an encounter near Damrancha last month. To take revenge for this killing, Naxals picked up Lakhan from Chhattisgarh and brought him to Kottagudam under Damrancha, where he was assaulted with sticks and stones, suspecting him to be a police informer”, a police statement said.

Lakhan was seriously injured in the incident. When the villagers found him in the morning, they informed the police, following which he was taken to Damrancha and given preliminary treatment.

The victim was then shifted to a hospital in Gadchiroli. After some medical tests, he was shifted to Nagpur for further treatment.

Lakhan’s condition is stated to be stable. — IANS, PTI
title: Mobile tower, panchayat office torched
